thread.title: Airlines Are Forgetting That My Wheelchair Is My Legs

author: wsjcom
title: Airlines Are Forgetting That My Wheelchair Is My Legs
text: As a wheelchair user and individual who flies several times a year, I am alarmed that the airlines are asking for regulatory relief from providing adequate service to customers with disabilities (“The Middle Seat: Airline Rules Are Up for Review,” Life & Arts, Feb. 8). I have found airlines increasingly unable to comply with the basic regulations that ensure I receive equal access to their service. My wheelchair is my legs. It isn’t a piece of luggage. The handling of my wheelchair has gotten worse during the past two decades. The problem isn’t the millions of people with disabilities who travel. The problem is that...
